wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the overall SentinelIQ platform. Explain its purpose as a security intelligence and digital brand protection system, highlighting core capabilities like threat detection, incident response (Aegis), brand monitoring (Eclipse), and multi-tenant workspace management. Describe the high-level architecture including the React frontend, Node.js/Wasp backend, Python analysis engine, and ELK stack for observability. Illustrate how components interact through APIs, WebSockets, and event-driven notifications. Include deployment topology using Docker Compose and key infrastructure services (PostgreSQL, Redis, MinIO). Provide context for beginners while detailing technical scope for developers. Use diagrams to show system context and data flow between major components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Crawling System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the crawling system component of the data processing engine. Explain the architecture and implementation of web_crawler.py and base_crawler.py, including their inheritance and extension patterns. Document how the crawler discovers and ingests data from external sources, handles rate limiting, retries, and HTTP errors. Describe configuration options in config.py that control crawling behavior such as concurrency, timeout, and user-agent settings. Include practical examples of crawler invocation from main.py, integration with Redis for task queuing via redis_client.py, and error logging using logger.py. Address common issues like blocked IPs, CAPTCHAs, and dynamic content loading, with solutions implemented in the codebase. Highlight performance considerations for scaling crawlers across domains and domainspecific crawling strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Hierarchy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the React component hierarchy in SentinelIQ's frontend. Explain the organization of reusable UI components based on ShadCN and Tailwind CSS, including form controls (input, select, checkbox), data display elements (table, card, badge), and interactive components (dialog, dropdown-menu, toast). Document the composition patterns used in higher-level components like DashboardPage and PlatformLayout. Include examples of component usage from actual pages such as DashboardPage.tsx and Module-specific components. Describe the role of utility components like EmptyState, LoadingSkeletons, and ErrorBoundary in maintaining consistent UX. Address accessibility considerations, responsive design implementation, and theming support through Tailwind classes.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for all Wasp-exposed endpoints in the backend. Document each endpoint's HTTP method, URL pattern, request/response schema, authentication requirements, and validation rules using Zod. Include detailed examples for file upload handling via multipart/form-data in upload.ts, screenshot generation in screenshot.ts, and email preview rendering in emailPreview.ts. Explain how input validation with ensureArgsSchemaOrThrowHttpError enforces type safety and returns structured error responses. Describe integration with Express middleware for payload size limits (10MB JSON, 50MB raw) and how these endpoints interact with core services like storage and email rendering. Address common client implementation patterns, error handling strategies, and performance considerations for large file uploads.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication and Authorization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the authentication and authorization system in SentinelIQ. Thoroughly explain the implementation of password policy enforcement, including complexity rules, hashing mechanisms, and breach detection. Document the two-factor authentication (2FA) flow using TOTP with speakeasy, including secret generation, QR code provisioning, token verification, and backup code management. Cover IP address whitelisting functionality, including configuration, request validation middleware, and enforcement logic. Explain session timeout controls with workspace-specific configurations, inactivity tracking, and periodic cleanup of expired sessions. Include integration points with Wasp's auth system, error handling patterns, and security event logging. Provide code examples from twoFactorOperations.ts and sessionTimeout.ts to illustrate key workflows, and address common issues such as locked accounts, recovery flows, and multi-device access.

wiki_catalogs.name: Alert Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Alert Management feature in the Aegis module. Explain how alerts are created, filtered, and displayed in the UI with severity and status indicators. Document the implementation of the EnhancedAlertForm and FilterPanel components, including their props, state management, and integration with backend operations. Detail the alert domain model, including fields like severity, status, observables, and associated TTPs. Provide examples from the codebase showing form validation, real-time filtering, and alert creation workflows. Address common issues such as duplicate alerts, false positives, and performance optimization for large alert sets.

wiki_catalogs.name: Brand Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Brand Monitoring feature of the Eclipse module. Explain how users configure and manage monitors for digital assets, including search terms, regions, languages, and detection rules (regex, YARA). Document the data model for BrandMonitor, its relationship with EclipseBrand, and monitoring lifecycle states. Cover the UI components for creating, viewing, and editing monitors, including the MonitorsTable and MonitorCard. Include integration with the crawling engine via CrawlTaskPayload and real-time status updates. Provide code examples from CreateMonitorInput, monitor operations, and scheduler jobs. Address best practices for optimizing monitor configurations and avoiding false positives.

wiki_catalogs.name: Entity Relationships
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the core entity relationships in the PostgreSQL schema. Detail the relationships between Users, Workspaces, Alerts (Aegis), Cases, Brands, Detections (Eclipse), Notifications, Audit Logs, and Ticket Providers. Explain foreign key constraints, referential integrity, and cascading behaviors. Document many-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-many relationships with practical examples from the migration files. Include visual schema diagrams showing table interconnections and cardinality. Provide sample JOIN queries demonstrating common access patterns across modules. Address data consistency challenges in a multi-tenant environment and how referential integrity is maintained across workspace boundaries.

Include configuration options for timeout settings, API keys, and sensitivity thresholds. Provide concrete code examples showing how domains are processed and scored. Explain error handling for network failures and rate limiting. Address performance considerations when processing large batches of domains and describe extensibility points for adding new reputation sources.

wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for setting up SentinelIQ in a local development environment. wiki_catalogs.name: Secure Transmission
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for secure transmission practices in SentinelIQ. Explain the implementation of HTTPS enforcement through HSTS with a 1-year max-age, includeSubDomains, and preload directives. Document the configuration of Content Security Policy (CSP) with strict source controls for scripts, styles, images, and fonts, including development exceptions for Vite. Cover secure cookie attributes (HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite) used in authentication flows. Detail WebSocket secure connections (wss://) and their integration with the frontend. Include examples from security.ts showing the configureHelmet() function with CSP directives for Stripe, Cloudflare, and MinIO/S3 endpoints. Explain how these measures collectively protect against XSS, CSRF, and clickjacking attacks. Address environment-specific configurations for development, staging, and production origins in the CORS implementation.

Explain the Logstash configuration file (logstash.yml) including pipeline setup, input sources, filters for parsing application logs, and output to Elasticsearch. Describe the Kibana setup script (setup.sh) that initializes dashboards, index patterns, and visualizations. Provide guidance on customizing pipelines for new log formats, scaling Logstash workers, and securing the ELK stack. Include troubleshooting tips for common ingestion issues and performance bottlenecks.

wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the core domain entities in the application. Detail the TypeScript interfaces and type definitions that represent business objects across modules including Aegis incidents and cases, Eclipse brand monitoring data, audit logs, and notification records. Explain entity relationships, field constraints, and data validation rules implemented through TypeScript types. Document how these frontend/backend shared types ensure consistency across the stack. Include examples of complex type compositions, discriminated unions for polymorphic data, and utility types for state management. Address the relationship between these type definitions and the underlying database schema, including how Prisma schema maps to these TypeScript types. Provide guidance on extending existing models and maintaining type safety.

wiki_catalogs.name: Timeline Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Timeline Tracking feature in the Aegis module. Explain how incident timelines are constructed by correlating alerts, cases, and TTPs (Tactics, Techniques, Procedures) from MITRE ATT&CK framework. Document the implementation of the Timeline component, including event rendering, zoom controls, and interaction patterns. Detail the backend operations for timeline data retrieval and the MITRE synchronization job. Provide examples from the codebase showing timeline data structures, event grouping, and integration with the MITRE framework. Address common issues such as timeline performance with large datasets, event deduplication, and accurate time correlation across distributed systems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Investigation Tools
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Investigation Tools in the Eclipse module. Explain how security teams investigate and respond to brand threats using alert correlation, audit trails, and data export capabilities. Document the investigation workflow from alert to resolution, including the use of AlertCard and AlertsTable components. Cover the AuditLogTimeline component for tracking user actions and system events. Include the data export functionality for generating investigation packages and compliance reports. Provide examples from alert aggregation logic, export workflows, and timeline visualization. Address integration with the Aegis incident response module and best practices for conducting thorough investigations.

wiki_catalogs.name: YARA Analyzer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the YARA Analyzer module that performs signature-based detection of malware and malicious patterns. Explain its implementation in yara_analyzer.py, including how it loads YARA rules from configuration, retrieves binary and text files from S3 storage via s3_client.py, and executes rule matching against file content. Document the rule management system, the scanning engine's memory and performance characteristics, and the output format of matches including rule metadata and matched strings. Provide code examples showing how YARA results are integrated into the main processing pipeline in main.py. Explain configuration options for rule sets, recursion depth, and timeout settings. Address error handling for malformed rules and corrupted files. Discuss performance optimization through rule compilation and indexing, and describe the workflow for adding and testing new YARA rules in the system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Ticketing System Integrations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Ticketing System Integrations in SentinelIQ. Document the provider pattern implementation where all ticket systems extend BaseTicketProvider and implement the createTicket method. Explain the unified interface (TicketMetadata, TicketResponse) that standardizes data exchange across different platforms. Detail each supported provider: Jira (Atlassian), ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, Linear, and GitHub Issues, including their specific API endpoints, authentication mechanisms, and field mappings. Describe the integration workflow from notification triggers in Aegis/Eclipse modules to ticket creation in external systems. Document the error handling and retry strategies for failed ticket creations and the audit logging of integration activities. Include configuration requirements for each provider (API keys, instance URLs, project mappings) and setup procedures. Provide code examples of creating tickets from security alerts with enriched metadata and custom field mappings. Address security considerations for storing provider credentials and rate limiting imposed by external APIs. Explain the extensibility pattern for adding new ticket providers by implementing the base class interface.

wiki_catalogs.name: Microsoft Teams Provider
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the TeamsProvider in SentinelIQ. Document the configuration requirements including webhook URL setup and authentication. Detail the Teams message builder implementation that creates Adaptive Card-compatible JSON payloads with MessageCard format, including theme colors (INFO, SUCCESS, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL), activity titles with emojis, and structured sections with facts. Explain the send method that handles HTTP POST requests to Microsoft Teams webhooks with proper error handling. Document the inclusion of contextual information like workspace name, timestamps, and actionable buttons for viewing details. Provide integration examples showing configuration and usage patterns, along with troubleshooting guidance for common issues like webhook configuration, message formatting limitations, and adaptive card compatibility.

wiki_catalogs.name: Timeline Tracking
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Aegis module's timeline tracking system. Thoroughly explain the implementation of timeline event creation, retrieval, and export functionality across alerts, incidents, and cases. Document how the operations.ts file handles timeline operations with proper validation, workspace authorization, and transaction handling. Include concrete examples from the timeline lifecycle, showing how events are automatically generated during key actions (creation, updates, assignments) and manually added for investigation notes. Explain the relationship between timeline operations and other components like audit logging, notifications, and data export. Address common issues such as cross-entity timeline correlation, data consistency, and export format handling. Provide guidelines for extending timeline functionality following the established patterns of input validation with Zod, proper error throwing with HttpError, and multi-tenancy enforcement.

wiki_catalogs.name: Linear Provider
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Linear ticketing provider integration in SentinelIQ. Document the configuration parameters including Linear API key, team ID, and default workflow state for new issues. Explain the authentication method using API keys and the GraphQL API usage for creating and managing issues. Detail how notification data is mapped to Linear issue fields such as title, description, priority (importance), labels, and assignee. Provide examples of how alert severity levels are translated into Linear's priority system. Include error handling for authentication failures, rate limiting, and invalid team or project configurations. Address troubleshooting steps for synchronization issues, missing fields, and permission errors. Document security considerations for API key storage and access control within Linear organizations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Linear Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the Linear integration in SentinelIQ. Detail how the LinearProvider implements the BaseTicketProvider interface to create issues in Linear's issue tracking system. Document the required configuration including API key, team ID, and priority mapping between SentinelIQ alerts and Linear priorities. Explain the transformation of alert data into Linear issue fields such as title, description, labels, and assignee. Describe the integration workflow where high-severity security alerts automatically generate high-priority issues in designated Linear teams. Provide implementation examples showing how Aegis incident data is enriched and formatted for Linear's Markdown-compatible description field. Cover authentication using Linear's API keys with appropriate permissions. Document error handling for invalid API keys, team access restrictions, and rate limiting. Include setup instructions for configuring the integration in the admin panel and best practices for maintaining visibility across security and development teams. Address synchronization considerations and strategies for handling bulk alert scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Backend Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Node.js backend powered by the Wasp framework. Describe the API endpoint structure, request lifecycle, middleware configuration (security, rate limiting, session management), and integration with Prisma ORM. Explain the operations pattern in core modules for business logic separation. Detail error handling with Sentry, input validation, and request context propagation. Cover WebSocket setup for real-time updates and background job processing. Document the service layer organization and interaction with external systems like Stripe and email providers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Telegram Provider
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the TelegramProvider in SentinelIQ. Document the configuration requirements including bot token setup and authentication. Detail the send method implementation that processes multiple recipients (chat IDs) and constructs HTTP POST requests to Telegram's Bot API sendMessage endpoint. Explain the message builder that creates HTML-formatted messages with type-specific emojis (INFO, SUCCESS, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL) and proper text formatting. Document the inclusion of inline keyboard buttons for link navigation and error handling for Telegram API responses. Provide examples of provider initialization, configuration patterns, and usage in notification workflows. Include troubleshooting guidance for common issues like invalid bot tokens, chat permissions, message length limits, and API rate limiting.

wiki_catalogs.name: GitHub Provider
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the GitHub ticketing provider integration in SentinelIQ. Detail the configuration requirements including repository owner, repository name, and GitHub token with appropriate scopes (e.g., repo, issues). Explain the authentication mechanism using personal access tokens or GitHub Apps, and document the REST API endpoints used for issue creation and comment updates. Describe how notification data is transformed into GitHub issue fields such as title, body, labels, assignees, and milestone. Provide examples of how alert metadata is converted into issue labels and markdown-formatted descriptions. Include error handling for rate limiting (403), authentication failures, and repository access issues. Address troubleshooting common problems like insufficient permissions, invalid repository configurations, and rate limit exhaustion. Document security best practices for token management and compliance with GitHub's security guidelines.

wiki_catalogs.name: GitHub Issues Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the GitHub Issues integration in SentinelIQ. Explain how the GitHubProvider extends BaseTicketProvider to create issues in GitHub repositories. Document the configuration requirements including GitHub API token, repository owner, repository name, and label mapping. Detail the mapping between SentinelIQ alert properties and GitHub issue fields such as title, body, labels, and assignees. Describe how the integration transforms security alerts into GitHub issues with comprehensive Markdown descriptions containing investigation context, evidence links, and MITRE ATT&CK references. Provide code examples showing how Eclipse brand infringement alerts generate GitHub issues in designated repositories for tracking remediation. Cover authentication using GitHub personal access tokens or GitHub Apps with appropriate permissions (issues:write). Explain error handling for repository access issues, rate limiting, and validation errors. Include setup instructions for configuring the integration in the admin interface and best practices for maintaining traceability between security events and development tasks. Address considerations for public vs. private repositories and handling of sensitive information in issue descriptions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Processing Engine
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Python-based data processing engine. Describe the crawling system using web_crawler.py to collect data from external sources, the analysis pipeline with domain_analyzer.py, ocr_processor.py, regex_matcher.py, and yara_analyzer.py, and the data persistence mechanism via db_client.py. Explain configuration management, error handling, and integration with the main application through database updates. Document the Docker deployment strategy and resource requirements. Include performance considerations for large-scale data processing and scalability options.

wiki_catalogs.name: Webhook Provider
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the WebhookProvider in SentinelIQ. Document the flexible configuration schema supporting custom URLs, HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), headers, and authentication mechanisms. Detail the payload structure that includes timestamp, workspace context, notification data, and event metadata in a standardized JSON format. Explain the send method implementation that constructs configurable HTTP requests with proper error handling and response validation. Document the extensibility features allowing integration with arbitrary third-party services and APIs. Provide examples of common integration patterns with external systems, security considerations for webhook security (signature verification, TLS), and troubleshooting guidance for connectivity issues, payload format errors, and rate limiting scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the security architecture of SentinelIQ. Detail the authentication flow including password policy enforcement, two-factor authentication (2FA), refresh token management, and session timeout controls. Explain IP address whitelisting implementation and its integration with request middleware. Cover data protection mechanisms, secure header configurations, and protection against common web vulnerabilities (XSS, CSRF, injection). Document audit logging of security events and compliance features. Include threat modeling considerations and security testing practices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Ticketing Providers
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the ticketing provider system in SentinelIQ. Document the implementation of Jira, ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, Linear, and GitHub providers for creating and managing tickets as part of notification workflows. For each provider, detail the configuration requirements, authentication methods (API tokens, OAuth), and integration endpoints. Explain the common interface implementation for creating tickets with title, description, priority mapping from notification type, and custom fields. Document the payload transformation logic that converts notification data into provider-specific ticket formats. Provide examples of cross-system integration patterns, error handling for API limitations, and troubleshooting guidance for common synchronization issues. Address security considerations for credential management and rate limiting strategies for external API calls.

wiki_catalogs.name: Aegis Module (Incident Response)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Aegis module focused on incident response and case management. Thoroughly explain the implementation of alert handling, case creation, chain of custody tracking, and timeline visualization. Document the domain model including alerts, cases, evidence, observables, and TTPs (Tactics, Techniques, Procedures). Include usage patterns for creating cases from alerts, managing bulk operations, and tracking incident resolution. Provide examples from the codebase showing form implementations, API interactions, and state management. Address common issues in incident workflow and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Eclipse Module (Brand Protection)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Eclipse module focused on digital brand protection and infringement detection. Explain the implementation of brand monitoring, infringement identification, and compliance tracking. Document the data model for brands, monitors, detections, and actions taken. Cover the user interface components for managing brands, viewing detections, and taking enforcement actions. Include integration with the notification system and ticketing providers. Provide examples from the codebase showing detection workflows, export functionality, and real-time updates. Address challenges in brand monitoring accuracy and false positive reduction.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the PostgreSQL database schema. Detail entity relationships between users, workspaces, alerts, cases, brands, detections, notifications, and billing data. Explain multi-tenancy implementation with workspace-based data isolation. Document key tables, fields, data types, primary/foreign keys, indexes, and constraints. Include business rules for data validation and integrity. Provide schema diagrams and sample queries. Cover data lifecycle management, retention policies for logs and audit trails, and migration strategies using Prisma.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for all public interfaces in SentinelIQ. For RESTful endpoints, document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, authentication methods (JWT), and error codes. For WebSocket APIs, document connection handling, message formats, event types (real-time notifications, progress updates), and disconnection handling. For payment processing, detail Stripe webhook integration and checkout flow APIs. For notification providers, document the interface for Slack, Discord, Email, and ticketing systems (Jira, GitHub, ServiceNow). Include examples for client implementation, rate limiting, versioning, and security considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment and Operations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for deployment and operational aspects of SentinelIQ. Detail the Docker Compose setup for local and production environments, including service configuration for frontend, backend, database, Redis, MinIO, and ELK stack. Explain environment variable management, network configuration, and volume mounting. Provide procedures for backup and recovery, monitoring with Kibana dashboards, and log analysis. Include scaling recommendations, health check implementation, and CI/CD pipeline considerations. Address production security hardening and performance tuning.

wiki_catalogs.name: Developer Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create a practical guide for developers contributing to the SentinelIQ codebase. Cover development environment setup, coding standards (TypeScript, Python, SQL), and testing strategies (unit, integration, end-to-end). Explain the contribution workflow including branching, pull requests, and code review processes. Document testing frameworks (Vitest, PyTest), linting rules, and formatting tools. Provide guidance on adding new features, writing maintainable code, and maintaining backward compatibility. Include debugging techniques, performance profiling, and extension points for new modules and integrations.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: SentinelIQ

## 1. Project Introduction

SentinelIQ is a comprehensive security intelligence platform built with Wasp and based on the Open Saas template. The application provides advanced monitoring, threat detection, and incident response capabilities with specialized modules for cybersecurity operations. The platform targets security teams and organizations requiring robust digital brand protection, threat intelligence, and compliance monitoring.

The core goals of SentinelIQ include:
- Providing real-time monitoring of digital assets and brand presence
- Enabling advanced threat detection through specialized analysis modules
- Facilitating incident response and case management workflows
- Supporting multi-tenant workspace collaboration with enterprise-grade security

## 2. Technical Architecture

The architecture of SentinelIQ follows a modern full-stack approach with a clear separation between frontend, backend, and data processing components. The system leverages a microservices-inspired design with specialized components for different functional domains.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client] --> B[API Layer]
    B --> C[Business Logic]
    C --> D[Data Access]
    D --> E[(PostgreSQL)]
    C --> F[(MinIO/S3)]
    C --> G[(Redis)]
    C --> H[ELK Stack]
    I[Python Engine] --> G
    I --> E
    I --> F
    I --> H
    H --> J[Kibana Dashboard]
```

The application follows a three-tier architecture:
1. **Frontend Layer**: React-based UI with ShadCN UI components
2. **Backend Layer**: Node.js/Express API server with Wasp framework
3. **Data Processing Layer**: Python-based engine for analysis and crawling

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- [App.tsx](src/client/App.tsx) - Frontend application root
- [serverSetup](src/server/sentry.ts#L11-L26) - Backend server initialization
- [main.py](services/engine/main.py) - Python engine entry point

### Core Modules
- [modules](src/core/modules/) - Feature-specific business logic
- [services/engine](services/engine/) - Analysis and crawling engine
- [server](src/server/) - API and infrastructure services

### Configuration Approach
- [middlewareConfig.ts](src/server/middlewareConfig.ts) - Express middleware configuration
- [docker-compose.yml](docker-compose.yml) - Container orchestration and service configuration
- Environment variables for service connectivity and operational parameters

### External Dependencies
- [package.json](package.json) - Frontend and Node.js dependencies
- [requirements.txt](services/engine/requirements.txt) - Python dependencies

### Integration Points
- [storage.ts](src/server/storage.ts) - MinIO/S3 integration
- [redis.ts](src/server/redis.ts) - Redis client configuration
- [elkLogger.ts](src/server/elkLogger.ts) - ELK stack integration
- [sentry.ts](src/server/sentry.ts) - Error monitoring and performance tracking

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Frontend] --> B[API Server]
    B --> C[Database]
    B --> D[Redis]
    B --> E[MinIO]
    B --> F[Sentry]
    G[Python Engine] --> C
    G --> D
    G --> E
    G --> H[Logstash]
    H --> I[Elasticsearch]
    I --> J[Kibana]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Security and Compliance
SentinelIQ implements comprehensive security measures including two-factor authentication, IP whitelisting, password policy enforcement, and session timeout management. The platform also includes audit logging and notification systems for compliance monitoring.

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Authentication
    Authentication --> TwoFactor: 2FA Required
    TwoFactor --> Session: Verification Complete
    Session --> Activity: User Interaction
    Activity --> Timeout: Inactivity
    Timeout --> Authentication: Session Expired
    Session --> Logout: User Initiated
```

### Multi-Module Architecture
The application features specialized modules for different security domains:
- **Aegis Module**: Incident response and case management
- **Eclipse Module**: Brand monitoring and infringement detection
- **Monitoring Module**: System and application monitoring

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Core Platform] --> B[Aegis Module]
    A --> C[Eclipse Module]
    A --> D[Monitoring Module]
    B --> E[Case Management]
    B --> F[Chain of Custody]
    C --> G[Brand Detection]
    C --> H[Infringement Tracking]
    D --> I[System Monitoring]
    D --> J[Alerting]
```

### Data Processing Pipeline
The system includes a sophisticated data processing pipeline that handles file uploads, image optimization, and storage management with automatic optimization and format conversion.

```mermaid
flowchart LR
    A[File Upload] --> B{File Type}
    B -->|Image| C[Image Optimization]
    B -->|Document| D[Direct Storage]
    C --> E[Format Conversion]
    E --> F[Metadata Extraction]
    F --> G[Storage in MinIO]
    G --> H[Database Reference]
```

Sources:
- [README.md](README.md)
- [package.json](package.json)
- [docker-compose.yml](docker-compose.yml)
- [middlewareConfig.ts](src/server/middlewareConfig.ts)
- [redis.ts](src/server/redis.ts)
- [sentry.ts](src/server/sentry.ts)
- [storage.ts](src/server/storage.ts)
- [imageOptimizer.ts](src/server/imageOptimizer.ts)
- [rateLimit.ts](src/server/rateLimit.ts)
- [healthCheck.ts](src/server/healthCheck.ts)
- [requestContext.ts](src/server/requestContext.ts)
- [validation.ts](src/server/validation.ts)
</blog>
